article_question:
[CLS]Jake wanted to eat an orange.  He liked fruit, and the only fruits in the house were
ewlineapples, which he didn't like, oranges, and strawberries, which made him itchy.  But his
ewlinemother had put oranges on top of the refrigerator.   Jake couldn't reach the top of the
ewlinerefrigerator.  He got the stool that he used to reach things in the cupboards.   But the
ewlinestool wasn't tall enough on its own.  He thought if he stood on the edge of the kitchen
ewlinesink he could reach the oranges.  (The kitchen sink was right next to the refrigerator).
ewlineSo he used the stool to get up to the edge of the sink, and then he stood on the edge of
ewlinethe sink to get the oranges.  He took one out of the bag and then put the bag back on top
ewlineof the refrigerator.  Then he used the stool to climb back down again with his orange.  He
ewlinesat at the kitchen table, peeled the orange, and ate it.  Then he took all of the pieces
ewlineof orange peel and threw them away in the yard waste.[SEP]What fruit was not in the house?

[CLS]James is going to the baseball field with his friend Tommy.
ewline
ewlineJames has to practice because baseball season starts in a week.
ewline
ewlineHe wants to be a good player when the season starts.
ewline
ewlineJames has been lazy in practicing so he is not very good at baseball right now.
ewline
ewlineHe has to make up for it by playing baseball for 5 hours every day for a week.
ewline
ewlineJames thinks this is enough practice for him to catch up and be a good player when the
ewlineseason starts.
ewline
ewlineSo James and Tommy practice every day.  They throw the ball around.  They practice batting
ewlineand they practice fielding.
ewline
ewlineTommy begins to see that James is getting better every day.  He says "I do not believe it,
ewlineJames, but I think you are going to be pretty good when the season starts!"
ewline
ewlineUsually a week is not enough time to get pretty good at baseball but James is practicing
ewlineso much he is fitting a month of practice into one week.
ewline
ewlineThen James has a setback.  His glove rips during practice.  He can't keep playing with a
ewlinebroken glove!
ewline
ewlineSo Tommy and James go around town collecting bottles to trade in for five cents for each
ewlinebottle.
ewline
ewlineJames misses a day of practicing but they find enough bottles to turn in for thirty
ewlinedollars.
ewline
ewlineThis is enough money for James to buy a new glove!
ewline
ewlineSo James buys a new glove and he and Tommy go back to the field and practice some
ewlinemore.
ewline
ewlineBy the time the season comes James is one of the best players on his team.[SEP]How long does James have to play every day for a week to be good at baseball?

[CLS]Billy had a pet turtle that he took good care of, everyday.  His turtle's name was
ewlineTumble.  Tumble liked to walk around outside in the garden and dig small holes to sleep
ewlinein.  Billy loved Tumble and would visit him outside when he got home from school.
ewlineTumble's favorite food was oatmeal.  So, every day after school, Billy would make Tumble a
ewlinebig bowl of oatmeal and take it outside for Tumble to enjoy.  Tumble would see Billy and
ewlinewalk up to him as fast as a turtle can go.  Billy would put the bowl down and wait for
ewlineTumble to come up to the bowl to eat from it. When Tumble reached the bowl, he put his
ewlinenose on it.  But, the oatmeal was too hot to eat.  Billy reached down and blew on the hot
ewlineoatmeal, to cool it down for Tumble to eat.  Once the oatmeal was cool enough, Tumble
ewlinecould dig in and eat his big bowl of oatmeal.  Billy loved to watch as Tumble ate his bowl
ewlineof oatmeal, because Billy took good care of Tumble, everyday.[SEP]What was Billy's turtle name?

[CLS]Sarah is a girl. Sarah has one brother. Sarah's brother's name is Timothy. Sarah has one
ewlinesister. Sarah's sister's name is Annabelle. Their last name is MacGregor. One day Sarah
ewlinewent to the park with her brother Timothy. They swung on the swings for a short time. Then
ewlineAnnabelle came out and swung with them. They all sang some nice songs together. They all
ewlinebecame very  happy. Then Timothy's friend came. Timothy liked his friend very
ewlinemuch. Timothy went off the swing and went away with his friend. Then Annabelle and Sarah
ewlinefelt very very sad. Happily then Annabelle and Sarah's friend came. Their friend's name was
ewlineKate Smith. She was the same age as Sarah. They wanted to go to the slide together. So
ewlinethey went to the slide and played for a long time. Then Annabelle became happy. And Sarah
ewlinealso became happy. Then they went home together and had some food.[SEP]How many brothers and sisters does Sarah have?

[CLS]Flying a kite can be dangerous. When I was eight years old I went to the park with my dad
ewlineto fly my new kite. We stood on the top of a hill and tried to catch the wind. It took us
ewlinealmost half an hour, but we finally got the kite into the air. As it lifted into the sky,
ewlinethe kite caught the edge of my jacket and I was pulled up into the wind with the kite. I
ewlineflew higher and higher into the air until I my dad looked like an ant on the ground. The
ewlinepark was beautiful from up high, and I could see our car getting smaller. I flew all the
ewlineway out of the city and over the lake. Eventually, the wind started to die down and I fell
ewlinecloser to the water. I called out to some people on a boat and they sailed over so I could
ewlineland on their boat. I told them about my adventure and they sailed me back to land, where
ewlinemy dad picked me up. He took me out for ice cream and we went home.[SEP]Why does the main character say it can be dangerous to fly a kite?
A: Because the kite has sharp edges.
B: Because the kite string got twisted around her.
C: Because she got caught on the kite and pulled up into the air.
D: Because she ran too fast with the kite and fell down.

article_question:
[CLS]John bought a new puppy. He named the new puppy Spike. Spike was a good dog and minded
ewlineJohn. John took Spike to the pond behind his house. Spike loved playing in the water. John
ewlinewould throw the frisbee to Spike. He would also throw a bone to Spike. Spike loved
ewlinerunning. Jessica came to the pond to visit John. Jessica and Tom always played with

ewlinethem being a good dog. When they were done eating they packed their lunch up. They put
ewlineSpike on his leash and they went home.[SEP]What did Jessica bring to the pond?

[CLS]One day Billy and Sandy went to the neighborhood fair. They were so exited because this
ewlineyear Bob the clown was going to be there. They had heard a lot about Bob the clown, he was
ewlinefunny and knew a lot of balloon tricks. He always made the kids laugh and gave out small
ewlineprizes to many of the children at the fair. Billy and Sandy had even heard that sometimes
ewlineBob the clown would give out free cotton candy and candy apples. They had waited all year
ewlineand were so excited. They did all their chores and cleaned their rooms so they could go to
ewlinethe fair. When they got to the fair they were so happy to see that Bob the clown was
ewlinehanding out cotton candy and candy apples. Billy and Sandy waited in line and then once it
ewlinewas their turn Billy got a balloon in the shape of a dog and Sandy got a big bag of cotton
ewlinecandy. They were both happy and could not wait to tell their friends all about Bob the
ewlineclown.[SEP]Where were Billy and Sandy going,and why were they so excited?
A: The Fair, and because the rides were fun
B: The park, and because Bob the clown was going to be there
C: The art show, and because Bob the clown was going to be there
D: The fair, and because Bob the clown was going to be there

article_question:
[CLS]Johnny is a nine year old boy.  On one hot summer day, Johnny is outside his house playing
ewlinewith his dog.  He is very hot and wants to have some ice cream.  He looks in his freezer
ewlineand sees that he does not have ice cream.  Johnny then hears the song of the ice cream
ewlinetruck.  Johnny runs outside but does not see the ice cream truck.  He looks down the
ewlinestreet but the ice cream truck is nowhere to be found.  The music of the truck starts to
ewlineget softer and then louder.  Johnny waits outside for an hour.  Johnny then thinks that he
ewlineneeds money when the ice cream truck comes. He runs inside and finds five dollars in his
ewlineroom.  He then hears the ice cream truck song get very loud.  He runs back outside and
ewlinesees the truck pass his house.  Johnny runs after the truck and catches up with it.
ewlineJohnny buys 4 ice cream pops and some candy.  He gives his five dollars to the ice cream
ewlineman and gets one dollar back.  He walks home and happily eats all of his candy and ice
ewlinecream.[SEP]What does Johnny want to eat when he is playing outside?

[CLS]The dog was playing in the street outside. I walked past the dog and threw the ball to
ewlinehim. He seemed to be hot from the heat of the day. I then headed to the store because I
ewlineneeded to buy some food and other things that were needed. I entered the store and said hi
ewlineto Mr. Jones. He had been working at the store for a long time. I walked to the back of
ewlinethe store and picked up some cold sodas and a bottle of orange juice. I then went and
ewlinepicked up some popcorn. This would be good for eating later while watching tv. I then went
ewlineto the dog food section and picked a meat treat for the dog. I then went up to the front
ewlineof the store and paid Mr. Jones. He smiled and thanked me for shopping at his store. Then
ewlineI walked back to my house and looked at the dog. His name was Rex and had lived with us
ewlinefor around four years. His coat was brown and white. I unwrapped the dog treat and gave it
ewlineto him. Rex seemed happy and started to lick my hand in happiness. He was a good dog and
ewlineit made me feel good that he was happy.[SEP]what color was the dog

[CLS]Timothy likes to play sports. He spends his time after school playing basketball and
ewlinebaseball. Sometimes Timothy pretends he is a famous baseball pitcher for his favorite team
ewlinewith his friends. He plays with his friends Mandy and Andrew. Timothy also plays pretend
ewlinewhen he is alone. He has an imaginary friend named Sean. Sean is an elephant who watches
ewlinetelevision with Timothy.
ewline
ewlineMandy likes playing baseball but she also likes to paint. Mandy's favorite class at school
ewlineis art. She likes making pictures of flowers. Her teacher says she is a good artist. She
ewlinepainted a picture of a tree for her teacher. There were red and yellow leaves on it. It
ewlinehad apples on it.
ewline
ewlineWhen Andrew goes home after baseball, he likes to eat a snack. He eats carrots and
ewlinebananas. If he is a good boy his mom, Mrs. Smith, sometimes gives him milk and
ewlinecookies. Afterwards, Andrew finishes his homework.[SEP]What does Mandy like to paint?

[CLS]The other day Mitch went to the store to buy his mother a big turkey. Inside the store
ewlinethere was food all over! Mitch could not believe his own little eyes. From the first time
ewlineMitch woke up this morning he knew that he'd be a big man someday, and getting a big
ewlineturkey for his mother was the way in which he could show that he is a big man. The store
ewlinehad all kinds of food from chocolate bars to yummy radish. Mitch ran for the turkey
ewlinesection of the store with much force. "Turkeys are good, yummy yummy in my tummy, I want
ewlineto eat a big old turkey and then go to the bathroom several times!" Mitch would cry out to
ewlinestrangers he met in the turkey section of the store. Then, four and a half seconds later,
ewlineMitch turned into a giant Walrus named Ted! No one knew how this could have happened, but
ewlinethe Walrus knew. A few years later, Mitch the now giant Walrus named Ted joined the circus
ewlineand became a rich man with green in his heart. He could not think of anything else
ewlinebut making more money at his circus. One day Ted the giant Walrus, also known as Mitch the
ewlinehappy boy, remembered that his mother still wanted a big turkey for her late night
ewlinebreakfast. Now that Ted was a giant walrus making money hand over fist, he could buy his
ewlinemommy a big old turkey for their night time breakfast. Ted the walrus also remembered that
ewlinehe had earlier built a time machine. Ted the giant walrus used his time machine to go back
ewlinein time to buy his mother who was now a dog named Herbert. Ted's mother, Herbert loved the
ewlinebig turkey, but there was a small problem. Herbert the dog didn't have any teeth![SEP]What are the different types of food found in the store?
A: no food is in the story.

article_question:
[CLS]Here begins the story of the life of Tim. Tim's father was Frank. Frank's father was
ewlineJim. Jim's father was Greg. And Greg's father was Mark. These 5 men had ruled Markton for
ewlinethe last 100 years. For the last 20 years, Tim had been the ruler. When Frank died, Tim
ewlinebecame the ruler. In these last 20 years, Tim brought lots of good luck to his
ewlinepeople. They had never eaten so well. Most of his people ate 3 meals a day. Recently, Tim
ewlinehad been having trouble with a band of troublemakers led by Horace. Tim chose to do
ewlinewhatever he could to get rid of Horace. So, he got Assassin to get rid of Horace. One
ewlinenight Assassin sneaked into Horace's bedroom and did away with him. With the bad man gone,
ewlineall the people had a giant party and sang a song about the greatness of their ruler.[SEP]How many years has Tim ruled?

[CLS]Bob is a young child who eats potatoes. He normally wakes up around 7 in the morning. He
ewlinehas a dog named Gob. Gob is a very smart dog. Bob also owns a farm. He grows potatoes on
ewlineit. One day he went out with his dog to go check on the farm. There they found a wild
ewlineduck, a cat, and a pumpkin. Gob started to chase the duck. The duck flew away. Gob started
ewlineto get hungry. Gob then ate the pumpkin. Bob got mad at Gob for eating the pumpkin. Bob
ewlinethen threw Gob into the house. Bob then grabbed a bucket. He started to collect as many
ewlinepotatoes as he could find. Bob loved potatoes. He collected around 600 potatoes! Bob
ewlinestarted to run out of room for all the potatoes he found. He then started to eat as many
ewlineas he could. In 1 hour he ate 100 potatoes! He got so full he took a nap. When he awoke he
ewlinefound the cat eating all the potatoes! The cat ate 200 potatoes before Bob awoke. However,
ewlineBob was too full and fat to move. The cat laughed and wanted to eat the potatoes
ewlineagain. Just then, Gob comes running out to chase the cat away! The cat was too fat to run
ewlineaway. It had eaten too many potatoes! Gob grabbed the cat with his teeth and tossed the
ewlinecat down a well. Gob became a hero for saving the potatoes! Bob now lets Gob eat whatever
ewlinehe wants, including pumpkins! Gob is a very happy dog now![SEP]Why did Bob throw Gob into the house?

[CLS]Mary loved walking through the woods with her dog, Max.  Max and Mary would go on all
ewlinesorts of adventures together.  They really loved looking for blueberries together and then
ewlinefalling asleep next to each other in the tall grass.  One day, as Mary was picking the
ewlineblueberries, she turned around to find that Max was not there.  She became worried and ran
ewlineoff to look for her dog.  
ewline
ewlineShe looked in all of their favorite spots...next to the stream, in their secret hiding place
ewlinebehind the raspberry bushes, and even inside the old cabin that sat in the woods.  But
ewlinepoor Max was nowhere to be found.  Nonetheless, Mary would not give up.   She kept looking
ewlineand she found him not very far away.  He had seen a squirrel and run to chase it.  When
ewlineMary called Max's name he left the squirrel and happily returned to Mary, wagging his tail
ewlineas he went.[SEP]What was Mary doing in the woods?

[CLS]Jenny was a 13 year old girl with blond hair and blue eyes.  She had gotten out of her
ewlinelast day of school and was free for the summer.  Two of her friends were going to the
ewlinenearby beach to do some swimming and enjoy the sun. Jenny went with them and when they got
ewlinethere the beach was very full and there were people everywhere.  They changed into their
ewlinebathing suits and went to the water.  The water was very cold.  They chose not swim and
ewlinewalked to the sand.  Then they laid down on some towels and enjoyed the sun.
ewline
ewlineAfter several hours Jenny and her friends fell asleep.  They woke up and the sun was
ewlinebeginning to set.  When Jenny sat up she found that it was painful to touch her skin.
ewlineWhen she looked down she saw that she had a very bad sunburn.  Her friends were also very
ewlinebadly sunburned so they went home.  Jenny's mother gave her a cream to put on the sunburn.
ewlineAfterwards she felt a lot better and went to sleep.[SEP]What was the name of the girl with blond hair and blue eyes?

[CLS]Lisa has a pet cat named Whiskers. Whiskers is black with a white spot on her
ewlinechest. Whiskers also has white paws that look like little white mittens.
ewline
ewlineWhiskers likes to sleep in the sun on her favorite chair. Whiskers
ewlinealso likes to drink creamy milk.
ewline
ewlineLisa is excited because on Saturday, Whiskers turns two years
ewlineold.
ewline
ewlineAfter school on Friday, Lisa rushes to the pet store. She wants to buy
ewlineWhiskers' birthday presents. Last year, she gave Whiskers a play mouse
ewlineand a blue feather.
ewline
ewlineFor this birthday, Lisa is going to give Whiskers a red ball of yarn
ewlineand a bowl with a picture of a cat on the side. The picture is of a
ewlineblack cat. It looks a lot like Whiskers.[SEP]What does Lisa buy for Whiskers for this birthday?
A: A bowl with a cat on it
C: A red ball of yarn and a bowl with a cat on it

article_question:
[CLS]School is out for the summer.  Jake and Jimmy are playing on a baseball team. They are
ewlineboth nine years old this year.  Their team is called the Knights.  Jake plays first base
ewlineand Jimmy is a pitcher.  They both love baseball.  They started playing when they were
ewlinefour years old.  It is so fun for them.  Their team has won three games so far.  They beat
ewlinethe Jets, the Bluejays, and the Hawks so far.  They have not lost any games yet.  They are
ewlineplaying the Tigers today.  The Tigers have not lost any games either.  The score was one
ewlineto one until the last inning.  There were two outs.  Jimmy came to the plate.  The pitcher
ewlinenamed Johnny threw the ball hard.  Jimmy swung his bat too late and missed.  He missed the
ewlinenext pitch too.  It was too fast.  He was ready for the next pitch.  He hit it hard to
ewlinecenter field.  The Tiger player in center field jumped to catch it, but it went over his
ewlinehead and over the fence.  It was a home run!  The Knights won the game![SEP]What team are the Knights playing today?

[CLS]Tommy's birthday is next week.  He is hoping for a very special gift.  What are some
ewlinethings Tommy is hoping for?
ewline
ewlineHe would like a big, bouncy ball, like his friends Bobby and Joey have.  One with blue
ewlinestripes!
ewline
ewlineHe would really like some new sneakers.  Danny, Tommy's best friend, got a special pair of
ewlinesneakers for HIS birthday last month.  They have pictures of robots on them and even light
ewlineup when you walk!
ewline
ewlineHe would really, REALLY like a shiny new bicycle.  Tommy has an old bicycle now. He is
ewlinegetting too big for it.  He saw a red one in the store yesterday when he was shopping with
ewlinehis Mom.  It looked like it was the right size for him!
ewline
ewlineBut what Tommy wants most of all is a new baby brother.  Today his Mom and Dad said that
ewlinehe might have one very, very soon.  Then Tommy and his little brother can have many fun
ewlinebirthdays together.  That would be the best gift of all![SEP]Who is Tommy's best friend?

[CLS]Mary was a little girl who loved to sew. She liked to sew dresses, shirts, and skirts but
ewlineMary hated to sew quilts. She didn't like anything about sewing quilts and blankets
ewlinebecause it took too long. One quilt or blanket took a week to make, when a skirt or shirt
ewlinetook one night! Mary's mother didn't understand why Mary didn't like to sew quilts and
ewlineblankets because Mary's mother loved to!
ewline
ewlineMary was a normal little girl even if her friends didn't think so all the time. Mary's
ewlinefriends liked to play games and play outside but all Mary liked was to sew. She woke up
ewlineand she began to sew. She only stopped to eat and use the bathroom. Mary's father was very
ewlineworried about Mary. He said that little girls needed to laugh and play, not sew all the
ewlinetime. 
ewline
ewlineOne day Mary's father took Mary's sewing things and gave them to the poor children. "No
ewlinemore sewing, Mary!" He said. He wanted her to go laugh and play with her friends instead of
ewlinesew but instead of going outside to play she ran into her room and cried. Mary was very
ewlinesad that she couldn't sew any more. Soon her friends came over to see why Mary hadn't come
ewlineover to play like her father said she would. When they saw her crying on her bed they had
ewlineto think of a way to cheer her up. Billy said that maybe they could let her sew at their
ewlinehouses. Abby thought it was a great idea. So then all Mary's friends bought sewing things
ewlinewith their money so that Mary would be happy again. When Mary's father saw Mary go to one
ewlineof her friend's house he was very happy. Soon everyone was happy again.[SEP]What are two of Mary's friends' names?

ewlineapples, which he didn't like, oranges, and strawberries, which made him itchy.  But his

ewlinethe sink to get the oranges.  He took one out of the bag and then put the bag back on top

C: it doesn't reach the edge of the sink

article_question:
[CLS]Once upon a time there was a cute brown puppy. He was a very happy puppy. His name was
ewlineRudy. Rudy had a best friend. His name was Thomas. Thomas had a nice dad named
ewlineRick. Thomas and Rudy had been friends for almost a year. Rudy and Thomas loved to play in
ewlinethe big back yard. Sometimes, Thomas would ask his friend Jacob to come to the back yard
ewlineand play with them. Jacob would always bring his puppy too. Jacob's puppy was named
ewlineSally. Thomas and  Jacob would run around the back yard and Rudy and Sally chased them and
ewlinebarked. They all had so much fun playing together. One day, Thomas told Rudy that tomorrow
ewlinewould be a very special day. It would be Rudy's birthday. Rudy was very excited. The next
ewlineday came and Thomas threw a birthday party for Rudy. All of Rudy's friends were there and
ewlinethey had presents for him. Jacob brought Rudy a new ball and Sally brought him a
ewlinebone. There was one more present for Rudy to open. When he opened the gift from Thomas,
ewlineRudy was so exited that he jumped and barked. It was a new red collar with a shiny name
ewlinetag on it. It was the best gift Rudy had ever been given.[SEP]Where did Rudy and Thomas love to play?

[CLS]Once upon a time there were three rabbits, named Winston, Chester, and Francis. Chester
ewlinewas a brown rabbit with large eyes. Francis was grey and white and had messy fur. Winston
ewlinewas black and very fat. They were very happy rabbits who loved to eat. Every day they
ewlinewould leave their home, cross a road, and go through a small forest to get to a meadow of
ewlinegrass. They loved to eat that grass. One day, Chester thought he smelled something
ewlineinteresting. At first he thought it might be dirt. Then he thought maybe some sort of
ewlineflower. So, he asked a nearby squirrel. The squirrel's name was Acorn. Acorn said that he
ewlinethought it was mushrooms. However, Francis, the smartest rabbit, went to go look, and he
ewlinelearned that it was actually a garden of carrots. The rabbits were all excited. They all
ewlineloved carrots! They ate all the carrots.[SEP]Where did the rabbits go to eat everyday?

[CLS]The best afternoon I ever had with my grandfather was when we went down to the river and
ewlinefished.  It was a hot July day, and I was bored. My grandfather was sitting in the
ewlinebackyard, reading. "Hey, you look like you need some fun," he said.  "Want to go fishing?"
ewlineI said sure, and he went to the garage.  He came out with two poles, some hooks, and some
ewlinefishing line. Everything was in pieces, but he showed me how to put it all together.  I
ewlineasked if we needed worms, and he said no. Then, we set off to the river.
ewline
ewlineIt was only about ten blocks to the river, but walking along past the library and the
ewlinestore, he told me about how he used to go fishing with his friend Steve. They used to
ewlinecatch catfish, then take them home so that their mothers could cook them for dinner.  When
ewlinewe got to the park at the river, my grandfather went right to the bank, then turned and
ewlinewalked up along the side of the river until we were off in the shade under the trees right
ewlineat the edge of the park. There, he taught me how to throw my line in the water. Then we
ewlinesat down to wait. While we were fishing, my grandfather told me lots of stories about what
ewlinehe and Steve did as kids. We didn't have any worms, so we never caught any fish, but
ewlinesitting there as he told me stories made it a great afternoon.[SEP]Who cooked the catfish?

[CLS]On Saturday, Amy and Joe baked a whole chicken for their family's dinner.  They rinsed it
ewlinein cold water, rubbed it with spices, and put it into a pan.  After they had heated up the
ewlineoven, they put the chicken and the pan on the center oven rack and set the timer.  Then,
ewlineas they peeled potatoes and carrots to go with the chicken, Amy, Joe and Cindy talked
ewlineabout dinner.
ewline
ewlineAmy said, "Joe, this is too much food for you, me and little Cindy to eat in one night.
ewlineWe'll have leftovers.  What can we do with the leftover chicken?"
ewline
ewlineJoe said, "We could make chicken sandwiches or chicken and rice."
ewline
ewlineAmy said, "How about chicken soup?"
ewline
ewlineCindy said, "I like chicken with Thai noodles with red peppers.  We haven't made those in
ewlinea long time." 
ewline
ewline"That sounds good," said Amy.  "We'll make that for dinner tomorrow."
ewline
ewline"Yum!" said Joe.  "That's a great idea.  I love Thai noodles."
ewline
ewlineLater, Joe, Amy and Cindy had finished eating dinner, and Cindy asked Amy for help with
ewlineher homework.  "I don't understand how to do these math problems!"
ewline
ewlineJoe said, "You two go ahead.  I'll do the dishes and put away the leftovers."
ewline
ewlineSoon, Cindy went into the kitchen to get a glass of water.  Joe was eating the chicken.
ewlineIt was almost gone!
ewline
ewline"Dad!" said Cindy, "You have eaten almost all of the leftover chicken. We can't have Thai
ewlinenoodles with chicken tomorrow."
ewline
ewlineJoe looked very sad.  He said "I'm sorry.  I have been a bad dad.  I have to buy more
ewlinechicken so that we can still have noodles.  Would you like a piece of chicken?"[SEP]Why did Joe feel sad?
A: Because Cindy wanted Amy to help her with her homework
B: Because the chicken was no good
C: Because he ate an ingredient needed for tomorrow's dinner
D: Because Cindy went to get a glass of water

article_question:
[CLS]Bob walked out the door with a huge grin on his face. It was his first day of middle
ewlineschool. His mom, who is a nurse at the high school, waved at him as he entered the
ewlinebus. The bus driver said "good to see you Bob". Bob said "you too Mr. Smith".  Bob was so
ewlineexcited to see his friends that he could barely breathe. As he walked down the school bus,
ewlineBob's friends Jill, Jim, Jeff and Chris all waved to him. Instead of sitting next to his
ewlinebest friend Chris, Bob turned left and sat next to Jill. Jeff and Jim started laughing at
ewlinehim and teased "Bob and Jill sitting in a tree, K-I-S-S-I-N-G". Bob's face turned red from
ewlineembarrassment.  Chris felt bad for Bob and reached into his pockets to help his
ewlinefriend. When he reached in, he felt a pencil, a rock and a folded up piece of
ewlinepaper. Chris's eyes twinkled. He had a plan. Without Jim and Jeff seeing, Chris quickly
ewlinemade a paper airplane with the piece of paper he found in his pocket. He threw the paper
ewlineairplane at Jim. The plane hit Jim in the face. Both Jim and Jeff stopped laughing. Bob
ewlinelooked over to Chris and smiled.[SEP]What did Chris pull out of his pocket?

[CLS]Laura wanted to go to the park and play because she wanted to see her friends. When she
ewlinegot to the park Laura did not see anyone. After looking, she saw her friend George by the
ewlinebasketball hoop. George was playing all by himself. George was happy when he saw
ewlineLaura. Laura and George played basketball they saw the ice cream man driving in his
ewlinetruck. George asked Laura if she wanted him to buy her an ice cream cone. Laura said she
ewlinewould like him to do that. Laura sat on the bench as George walked to the ice cream
ewlinetruck. Laura looked in the sky and saw a pretty bird flying in a large circle. The bird
ewlineflew away. George came back with two ice cream cones. One of the ice cream cones had
ewlinerainbow sprinkles on it. George gave the ice cream cone with sprinkles to Laura. George and
ewlineLaura sat on the bench and watched a group of boys play football as they ate their ice
ewlinecream cones. One of the boys broke his leg. When George and Laura were finished with their
ewlineice cream, Laura ran home before the street lights came on.[SEP]Who got the ice cream cones?

ewlinethings Tommy is hoping for?
ewline
ewlineHe would like a big, bouncy ball, like his friends Bobby and Joey have.  One with blue
ewlinestripes!
ewline
ewlineHe would really like some new sneakers.  Danny, Tommy's best friend, got a special pair of
ewlinesneakers for HIS birthday last month.  They have pictures of robots on them and even light
ewlineup when you walk!
ewline
ewlineHe would really, REALLY like a shiny new bicycle.  Tommy has an old bicycle now. He is
ewlinegetting too big for it.  He saw a red one in the store yesterday when he was shopping with
ewlinehis Mom.  It looked like it was the right size for him!
ewline
ewlineBut what Tommy wants most of all is a new baby brother.  Today his Mom and Dad said that
ewlinehe might have one very, very soon.  Then Tommy and his little brother can have many fun
ewlinebirthdays together.  That would be the best gift of all![SEP]What makes Danny's sneakers special?
